title: "Assassins can hardly reach an ADC without dying first"
body:
Is finally something being discussed around Reddit, blaming the Assassin rework and ADC's current damage scaling at 2-3 items. My god, we may have a chance to convince Riot their game needs serious work.

Extra note: Many are mentioning on Reddit this **isn't even** taking into consideration the peel/heals of Supports.

Even when ADCs are complete shit, and they have been, people still find something to cry about like wanting more melee champs bot.

ADC is a far cry from being the easiest role in the game. I'd argue to say that Marksman have a harder role. Yes, Marksman right click to deal damage (almost like every other champion in LoL). However, they have a lot more to worry about that many other roles. I'd also venture to say that ADC positioning is the most imperative in team fights. Knowing where to place yourself, how to farm while staying aggressive, listening to teammates, paying attention to cool-downs, and attempting to live as nearly every enemy dives to kill you in quite difficult. Most people CANNOT ADC. As a support main I can tell the difference between auto-filled ADCs every time. 

As far as challenger players go, most if not all of them at this point can auto-fill. That being said, in no way does Pants compare to ADCs like C9 Sneaky, imaqtpie, Gosu, etc. Those are players who know the ins and outs of their champions, positioning, mechanics, micro and macro aggression, etc, which are all important and skill defining.

Its kinda the entire problem of assasins and adc. On one hand with assasins their entire existence makes adcs no fun. Not being able to do anything because you died in a quarter of a second is REALLY unfun and renders adcs somewhat useless(reason why everyone hates Zoe). At the same time an assasin not being able to do their job is not even worth having on a team. On the other end of the spectrum, an adc who just right clicks you to death(jinx kog trist) is no fun to play against while the adcs that are constantly reacting to others(lucian vayne kalista) are either too op or too underwhelming. Its extremely difficult to balance and instead of bickering about one class being op we should try to create new characters that fit the role while still not being problematic

1. Hard CC (Your R)
2. Vision (your E)
3. Slows (Your Autos/W).

But please, tell me next about how tanks shouldn't be able to take 3 tower shots and live.

Lol Ashe counters Assassin's the hardest? Are you serious? ADCs who counter Assassins, are ADCs with spammable movement spells, and self peel. Trist/Ezreal/Vayne/etc. It damn sure ain't Ashe.  If you jump on some Ashe and actually die in the 1 second ult stun, she was fed beyond belief and you were woefully behind. She can't even crit on the first shot. I mean are you serious right now. Might as well say Jhin counters assassins, too, since he can sometimes land a root when you jump on him. 

Its times like this when you see the real bias. Ashe is one of the worst ADCs in the game, and you are going to say she counters Assassins the hardest. What a joke. And I'm some kind of apologist? Hahahahhahahah. This is why Gameplay is a joke. You probably actually believe that.

Someone didn't read the post. Secondly, having mobility is not a counter, it's an escape. A COUNTER means it hurts them, as opposed to saving you. Ashe stun can be used to stun that assassin from the other side of the teamfight. 

Never said apologist. That's the other guy(s). Apologists usually aren't the person(s) in question.

>Secondly, having mobility is not a counter, it's an escape

To be fair, escapes are counters to melee assassins. Not on the same level as hard CC is, but still a counter.

If you're playing an assassin and, more likely than not, blowing your gap closer to get to the ADC only to have the ADC jumping away, you were effectively countered as you failed to do your job (take out a high priority target) while being, at best, useless until your CDs come back or, at worst, dead because you're a caster on CD in the middle of the enemy team.

Not to mention that once they recreate that gap they might as well 1v1 you because you now have to walk up to them eating some free damage.
An escape just means you survive for now, same as a stopwatch after one use.

Assassins are meant to assassinate squishy targets in general. That includes ADC's but its not solely made to kill them. It is also designed to kill mages and squishy-support style champions. Its main purpose is to clear the field of a HIGH-IMPACT target, not to take down just the ADC. Everyone is 'meant' to kill everyone in this game. :/

Not exactly. Some supports are meant to save, and tanks are meant to engage.

Also, mages only have Zhonyas for assassins, while marksmen can easily kill the assassin.

I mean....why play an assassin when you could just play a mage/tank to back up your ADC who pretty much shreds everything in front of them?

You're literally walking into your death by picking an assassin since they're extremely risky picks for mediocre reward. The good thing about the assassins pre-rework is that if they did actually go 20/0 they felt like they were 20/0. This is no longer the case since their damage is so delayed they can barely even do their jobs properly.

Meanwhile ADCs get to crit. for 800-1.2k damage and no one bats an eyelid......
assassins are fun to play but mages win games

> [{quoted}](name=YuGiHo,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=tETEO4yv,comment-id=00050000,timestamp=2018-02-07T10:27:40.456+0000)

> assassins are fun to play but mages win games

Hence why I said what I said.

Getting rid of assassin's burst speed and allowing the 'adc to react' means they have time to stopwatch, shield, heal through the burst, etc. Assassins used to be able to assassinate them before they could use all these tools.

Riot doesn't know what an Assassin even is. The point of an Assassination is to not see it coming... if you can react to it, then it's a pretty botched assassination. Wards, positions and proper skill usage countered Assassins. Now... you can counter an Assassin regardless of the situation. As long as your sla -- I mean, support is next to you.

Glad they got rid of FoTM. But I think shield stacking is pretty cancer.
The issue was there was no micro to beating an Assassin only macro.

Isn't that the point of a strategy game? Game is pretty cancer now because of the fact Riot doesn't want the strategy portion to remain intact. It's all about pressing every single button on your keyboard to peel or one shot people in rapid succession.
But you can out micro literally every other class, so why should Assassins be unbeatable by micro?

Not being able to react to something is just simply not fun. You should always be given a chance, a window where you can do something about it. Maybe it could be difficult, heck, even impossible, but you should always be able to react.

Despite all this ranting, I have been killed by assassins before I had time to use anything really, it still happens. It just happens less then it did before. it used to be that if I got zed ulted, It was basically a death, but now it feels like I can do something about it, theres a potential of outplay that previous in other seasons I didn't exactly feel.

I'm not saying I don't think assassins are weak right now - they are, and the fact that they die before they get anything done is a bit unfair, but I don't think they need to be killing people before they react to be effective. Its called watching cd's and knowing what tools are available to the target you want to kill.
So, should Mages be collateral damage if you allow Assassins to burst ADCs through their peel?

Mages should just be put on the same spot as ADCs should ideally be: Carries who can shred through an enemy team given that they have a frontline sturdy enough to protect them, but while ADCs are the kings of Single Target DPS, mages would be the AoE Burst variant. At such position, they'd also be highly vulnerable, for a justified reason. 

Or alternatively have them be more of a control class with some burst and much more durability. Or any choice between two of Damage, CC, and Tankiness should solve it.

The way it is, mages are simply kicked out of the Assassins/ADC+Supp arms race and left as an afterthought.

The ideal spot for assasins to be is being able to pick off an out of place squishy, even while the entire enemy team is nearby, and get out. If the ADC isn't surrounded by their tanks, they get picked off by an assassin. It keeps the ADC from being able to go wherever they want. Assassins become problematic when they can assassinate tanks, or when they can kill a squishy that's positioned correctly.

I think his point is that an ADC standing next to a friendly Taric (or whoever) is not "out of place".  If you catch the ADC solo greeding a side wave, it doesn't matter how much heal or peel their support could have provided, because they're NOT THERE.  *That's* the scenario assassins should excel in, not diving into the full team.

Other than *maybe* a Vayne stun into a wall, I have a hard time seeing an ADC surviving that kind of 1v1 when both sides have similar level and items.  Anyone want to post some clips?

Assassins are all about punishing stupidity, which can be frustrating when the enemy team refuses to play stupid, but that's why a lot of assassins can also splitpush, which improves the chances of someone trying to show up to 1v1 (not a marksman, unless they're stupidly fed or just stupid).
When twitch is better than a fucking rengar and they nerf KALISTA AGAIN,something is fucking wrong.

I've said it many times, and I'll say it again: assassins needed some more gameplay in their burst. Some were handled well, some weren't, but regardless they did need something changed else they would never be healthy.

But the problem remains: if you nerf one class entirely by making their burst slower, their targets will simply get all the opportunity to destroy them because they haven't been changed/nerfed appropriately. You cannot make it harder for all assassins to kill adcs, then not changed adcs, and expect everything to turn out well. Currently we're seeing the results of that. And the PBE buffs happening to Evelynn/Talon/Zed are nice but the core issue lies not in specific champions, but rather in the whole class. 

As a side note, Duskblade is massively overtuned. But can you imagine what would happen to the game, in its current state, if they finally got around to nerfing it? The main users are considered bad, the main targets of a Duskblade user are currently thriving. Damn, I sure hope they nerf Duskblade before fixing the rest :       ^)
